channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17095] The ClientSimpleScanner keeps retrying if the hfile is corrupt or cannot found
item.description: In RsRPCServices.scan, most of IOE are thrown as a ScannerResetException, even when the hfile is corrupt or it cannot be found. The ClientScannr.loadCache will keep retrying when the exception is ScannerResetException. We could throw CorruptHFileException and FileNotFoundException directly from server and don't retry the scan in the client.
item.summary: The ClientSimpleScanner keeps retrying if the hfile is corrupt or cannot found

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Use the TestScannerWithCorruptHFile to reproduce this issue.
ScannerResetException is a DoNotRetryIOException and it should come back to client as DNR exception only.. Will see ur patch.
Upload a patch to fix this. In this patch the RSRpcServices directly throws the CorruptHFileException and FileNotFoundException so that client won't retry after failure.

Thanks Anoop Sam John!
Right, the retry doesn't come from the RpcRetryingCaller ( It doesn't retry the operations because they are DNRException), the retry comes from the ClientScannr.loadCache, it ignores the ScannerResetException and keeps retrying after that.

We may have to do some general way? Than throw back FNFE and CorruptedHFile exception, an exception which will cause the op fully fail? Ya ScannerReset exception means on the same scanner no hope with retry but a fresh trial after creating new scanner might help(Like region is moved to other RS by this time). May be the down layer which actually see CorruptedHFile exception itself has to make the new Exception type , wrapping the original one? FNFE is in case of MOB where the ref cell resolve to some path but u r not able to find it. Correct?

We may have to do some general way? Than throw back FNFE and CorruptedHFile exception, an exception which will cause the op fully fail?

Yes, we can create a new exception to wrap the CorruptHFileException and FileNotFoundException. I think it is okay to fail the operations if the file is corrupt or not found. What is your idea?

May be the down layer which actually see CorruptedHFile exception itself has to make the new Exception type , wrapping the original one? FNFE is in case of MOB where the ref cell resolve to some path but u r not able to find it. Correct?

Correct, I found this when I debugged the MOB snapshot issues. Let me prepare another patch to address the comments. Thanks.

-1 overall

69	    } catch (Exception e) {

70	      LOG.warn("fail to shut down the cluster", e);

Why is the above needed ?
+1 after removing the try/catch in teardown --i.e. Ted Yu's comment above.

So we throw back CorruptedHFileException or FNFE back to client now so that we dont end up throwing ScannerResetException. It will be better if u can create a new HBase specific exception, extending DNRIOE for the HFile not found case. Being more generic and checking all possible cases, am ok we can do in another issue
Else +1
Upload a new patch V2, which wraps the FNNFE and CorruptHFileException into a DNRIOE.
